content.description: Don’t Wake A Dream Horse is a sit start finger crack problem that is just slightly overhung and Mother Nature has provided just the right footholds for an interesting and challenging problem. Start with your skirt in the dirt and pull up on the hand jam box and the obvious jug protruding from the wall right of the crack. Establish in the next cup box and figure out where your fingers fit! My first lap was a long one with much fiddling and learning the good and bad holds. (34.7404218, -98.5326232)Head up to Five Dog Slab from the first parking pullout on mt scott road and at the base of five dog slab cheat WNW and eventually cross an incut slope that heads downhill to the SW uphill to the NE. Across this ditch on a south facing wall below other hand cracks and a prominent stack of rocks you should see Don’t Wake A Dreaming Horse.There is a higher exit to complete for more finger crack climbing so please finish it! I needed a partner and another pad to do it!

Black Mare, Night Lightning is the natural highball continuation of Don’t Wake A Dreaming Horse.Follow the crack as it thins and winds up the second face instead of exiting to the shelf on the left like Don’t Wake A Dreaming Horse.Landing is pretty good but multiple pads and spotters would be wise since no one comes to this part of Mt Scott regularly.
content.location: Continue Dont Wake A Dreaming Horse to the top of the cliff. (34.7404218, -98.5326232)

content.description:
Dreaming Horse boulder stack is located WNW of Five Dog Slab or coming from the gate and Gatekeepers area it’s the ditch runway that heads NE from the main rock-only talus slope that runs N up to Mt Scott from the road. 

  This area has a wide variety of cracks to climb and really good scrambling with competent rock.
